result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latrel C Hester-Hale

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Latrel C Hester-Hale.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a plea and sentencing hearing be set. Defendant is permitted to appear via zoom for P/S hearing. Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Latrel C Hester-Hale.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests additional time to review the discovery.  Request granted.  Defense given approval to appear via zoom. Case adjourned to Br. 9. Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant was present by video from Dodge Correctional prior to the case being called. Defendant has been disconnected due to time constraints. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court by video, defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant was not produced by video from Dodge for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No driving without a valid license.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Latrel C Hester-Hale in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Latrel C Hester-Hale appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
